oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Richard Houston Palmer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Richard Houston Palmer of Wilson County, Tennessee served in Co. D, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA and was paroled at the end of the war at Appomattox Court House, Virginia on April 9, 1865. This is a post Civil War image of Palmer and he wears a United; Daughters of the Confederacy Southern Cross of Honor on his lapel. Palmer died May 21, 1920 and was buried at Cedar Grove Cemetery in Lebanon, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Palmer, Richard Houston
